page.title: 18Swaylands School
page.content: The original house was built in 1850 by William Woodgate a retired solicitor living in Tonbridge. In 1871 George Drummond bought the house and more land. He kept adding to the 3 gabled house so that eventually it was 6 times its original size. In 1917 Sir Earnest Cassell bought it and made it a hospital. By 1947 it was a school. Swaylands is now a school for awkward boys.The school has 70 boys and nearly as many staff. The school and study centre are run by the London Borough of Barnet. Swaylands has gardens and rockeries and some bushes over 100 years old. The swimming pool used to be a rose garden. The farm has 6 fields 4 of which have sheep in. They do not have profit growing fields but they do pay their way. The soil has Wealden clay in it which is also good for making bricks.
